business.name: Brightful (formerly Khutwa)
business.registration_status: Registered with Ministry of Interior + Ministry of Finance (declaration pending but operating)
business.focus: Gender-based wellness, Sexual & Reproductive Health Rights (SRHR), Prevention of Sexual Exploitation, Abuse & Harassment (SEAH)

monthly_revenue.note: Not revenue-generating. Operates through grants and partnerships

funding_status.recent_example: 3 million dollar project currently working on as consultant
funding_status.youth_global_challenge: Won among 44 countries (10 selected), accessed funds

feminist_activist_identity.label: core_unwavering_intersectional
evidence: 'I'm a feminist activist and I believe we as women have systems thinking approach'
Intersectionality: patriarchy + capitalism + occupation + colonialism = resource denial
Women already have power to do anything - just lack resource ACCESS
Work based on needs assessment, ground research - not chasing trends
'I don't boycott UN, I don't boycott COP - I intersect the funds. Even if their values don't align with ours, I put it on table and say what I accept'

bloom_program_limited_participation.label: early_withdrawal_time_constraints
evidence: Applied to ACSI program but withdrew early (bootcamp + some of sprint)
Had other commitments, couldn't continue
Said she can't judge program framework since didn't complete
Wanted to know purpose of meeting before agreeing (direct communication style)

gender_mainstreaming_expertise.label: professional_trainer_policy_level
evidence: Trains other NGOs on gender mainstreaming
Teaches how organizations implement gender-sensitive approaches
Creates policies, accountability mechanisms, complaint procedures, assessments
Works with Ministry of Administrative Development (new ministry in Lebanon)
Careful not to reveal full feminist activist identity too early in policy work to avoid pushback

language_keywords_matter.label: deliberate_terminology_choice
evidence: Has entire module on keywords
Don't say 'beneficiary' - say 'right holders'
Keywords may seem normal to others but make HUGE difference in systems thinking approach
Shared module with Bilal if he wants

bilal_funding_concerns.label: pragmatic_questions_priorities
evidence: When Bilal said funding decreasing, Reem said: 'I don't see priorities changed. If proposal is strong and impact proven, there are still projects'
Examples: Injaz (100+ years, sustainable), it's about HOW you structure the enterprise
Suggested Bloom use insights to build stronger projects, not leave and start new things
Advised: Follow-up within programs, not just report and leave people

explicit_needs.evidence: Need support to access high-level conferences. Not just Reem, but her TEAM needs access to these platforms for exposure/learning
explicit_needs.current_gap: Everything funnels to Reem (capacity building, conferences) but team can't access

explicit_needs.evidence: Want to be at decision-making/policy-making tables, not just implementing funded programs. Have input to contribute to policy
explicit_needs.current_status: Starting to work with Ministry of Administrative Development but limited voice

explicit_needs.evidence: Don't have budget to invest $4000 for tickets + accommodation to send team to conferences. Reem gets invited but team doesn't
explicit_needs.example: Today received badge + passport for COP, but couldn't send team

implied_needs.inference: Careful to gradually introduce feminist perspectives in policy work. Needs platforms that recognize expertise without requiring full ideological disclosure upfront
implied_needs.evidence: 'In every discussion I try to pass messages, suggestions, recommendations so they consider them. But we're still on small level'

implied_needs.inference: Reem has economic sustainability through consultancy work. Collective can operate with or without funds. Not seeking funding sustainability for Brightful itself
implied_needs.evidence: 'I work as consultant with consultancy firm, have income. My goal from collective is NOT to seek income or sustain through funds. I can do awareness, field work, everything even without funds'

core_values.evidence: Feminist activist. Systems thinking: patriarchy + capitalism + occupation + colonialism intersect to deny resources. Women have power, need access
Programs designed from needs assessment, ground research. 'Many people chase trends, work for a while then stop. I don't chase trends'
'I intersect the funds. I don't boycott UN, COP, anyone. Even if values don't align, I put on table what I accept.' Takes funds from wherever, uses strategically
Entire module on keywords. 'Right holders' not 'beneficiaries'. Small words make huge systems difference
Part of feminist network in Lebanon. Collective groups work together, share resources. Not alone

interest_level.label: limited_not_seeking_funding_sustainability
evidence: Reem has consultancy income - doesn't need cooperative for financial sustainability
Collective operates with or without funds (proven: did 10K campaign with zero budget)
More interested in access to conferences, decision-making tables than funding models
Direct question to Bilal: 'Based on what I understood, what is the challenge we can help with? Is it funding, strategy, resources?'
interest_level.note: Reem's needs are ACCESS (conferences, policy tables, team exposure) not FUNDING

bloom_program_feedback.participation: bootcamp + partial sprint, then withdrew (time constraints)
critical_feedback: Bloom should use insights from past programs to build STRONGER projects, not leave things and start new
Need follow-up WITHIN programs for long-term, not just report and move on
Many programs (like Hir Mena accelerator from Cameron to Lebanon/Dubai) still exist - funding didn't change, just need strong proposals + proven impact
design_suggestions: Build on existing insights rather than starting new things
Structure enterprise better (like Injaz - 100+ years, sustainable)

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Strong expertise (gender mainstreaming, policy work, feminist organizing), established nonprofit (Brightful), proven funding access, 7 full-time team + 30 volunteers. BUT: Not seeking financial sustainability model (has consultancy income). Limited Bloom program participation (withdrew early). Needs are ACCESS (conferences, policy tables) not FUNDING. Wrong fit for revenue-share cooperative. Better fit: network for exposure, legitimacy, connections.

recommendation.reasoning: Reem's needs (high-level conference access, policy table seats, team exposure) don't match cooperative model (financial sustainability, revenue sharing, mutual support). She has financial sustainability. Better: Invite as EXPERT RESOURCE for gender mainstreaming training, keyword framing, policy access guidance - not as cooperative participant.
alternative_engagement: Invite to train cooperative members on gender mainstreaming
Consult on 'right holders' vs 'beneficiaries' language for cooperative
Connect to high-level conferences if Bloom has access
Policy-making connections if relevant to Bloom's work
recommendation.unique_value: Gender mainstreaming expertise, feminist intersectional framework, policy work (Ministry of Administrative Development), language/keywords expertise, Lebanon representation, collective organizing experience
recommendation.special_note: Reem gave critical feedback: Bloom should build on existing insights, not leave and start new things. Use past program learnings to make stronger projects. This is valid critique of Bilal's approach.

gender_mainstreaming_training.description: Reem trains NGOs on gender mainstreaming, policies, accountability, gender-sensitive approaches. Could train Bloom cooperative members

specifics.cooperative_benefit: Ensure cooperative operates with gender equity, not reproducing patriarchal patterns

gender_mainstreaming_training.action_required: If cooperative launches, invite Reem as trainer (paid) for gender mainstreaming

keywords_language_module.description: Reem created module on keywords importance. 'Right holders' not 'beneficiaries' - systems thinking through language

specifics.module_content: How keywords that seem normal actually make huge difference in systems thinking
specifics.reem_offer: I can share the module with you if you want
specifics.application: Cooperative language framing (participants? members? right holders? stakeholders?)

keywords_language_module.action_required: Get module from Reem, apply to cooperative language design

critical_feedback_integration.description: Reem's critique: Bloom shouldn't leave past programs to start new things. Should use insights to build stronger projects with better follow-up

specifics.critique: Don't leave insights and start new. Build on what you learned. Follow-up within programs for long-term, not just report and leave
specifics.example: Hir Mena accelerator still exists (Cameron to Lebanon/Dubai). Injaz 100+ years. Funding exists if proposal strong + impact proven
specifics.reem_perspective: Challenge isn't funding disappearing - it's how you structure enterprise and prove impact

critical_feedback_integration.action_required: Bilal reflect: Is cooperative new thing or building on insights? How to maintain follow-up?

key_quotes.on_feminist_identity: I'm a feminist activist and I believe that we as women, as females, have a systems thinking approach which in my view is that we don't have access to resources because you have patriarchy, capitalism, occupation, colonialism - all these systems intersect with each other to make us in a specific space with limited access.
key_quotes.on_women_power: I believe women already have the power to do anything. There's just lack of resources to emerge. So based on this, I design programs - if there's no resources, make resources. Because I don't write programs for anything, I write based on needs assessment.
key_quotes.on_fund_intersectionality: I'm a feminist activist who intersects the funds. I don't boycott UN, I don't boycott COP, I don't boycott anyone. Even if their values don't align with ours, I put what I have on table and say what I accept. I take the beginning from these people, I don't boycott. This is also a reason I'm still continuing my work.
key_quotes.on_keywords_importance: We have entire module - we don't say 'beneficiary', we say 'right holders'. Maybe others see them as normal words with no meaning, but we found these keywords make HUGE difference in systems thinking approach.
key_quotes.on_economic_sustainability: I work as consultant with consultancy firm and have income. So I as collective group, my goal is NOT that I want to seek income or sustain this group through funds. No, I can do activities and everything even without funds because I have economic sustainability and financial sustainability through consultancy.
key_quotes.on_bloom_critique: I don't see that priorities changed. If there's strong proposal and proven impact before, there are still projects. Think about it - Injaz has 100+ years, they're sustainable. It's about HOW you structure the enterprise. Don't leave things and start new things. Use the insights you have, build stronger projects on them.
key_quotes.on_needs: What we're lacking is TIME to learn from initiatives we're doing. We're all in the NGO space - we lack time, we lack experience. What we lack more is being at these high-level conferences, discussion roundtables with decision makers, policy makers.
key_quotes.on_feminist_strategic_positioning: I'm starting to work with Ministry of Administrative Development. But I can't put everything I have on table from beginning because there's this view that I'm not social activist, I'm FEMINIST activist. So I don't put everything initially to avoid step backwards. In every discussion I try to pass messages, suggestions, recommendations so they consider them.

growth_edges: Direct communication style (wanted to know meeting purpose first)
Low interest in funding models (already sustainable)
Needs don't match cooperative model (access not funding)
meta_insights.unique_contribution: Gender mainstreaming expertise that cooperative NEEDS but Reem doesn't need cooperative. Better as expert resource than participant. Critical feedback on Bloom strategy valid: build on insights, don't leave and start new.
